column1: Rosamond was established in 1877 as a townsite owned by the Southern Pacific Railroad; it was named for the daughter of one of the railroad's officials. The first local industries were mining and cattle. During the 1890s
column2: gold was discovered in the area
column3: quickly drawing miners and prospectors. After the initial boom
column7: Muroc Army Air Field was established some 20 miles away; it was later renamed Edwards Air Force Base in honor of fallen test pilot Glenn Edwards.

column1: Willow Springs lies west of central Rosamond and was a watering hole for stagecoach travelers for generations
column2: though its springs have dried up. Willow Springs Raceway is nearby
